reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthening Health Systems and Scaling up Prevention and Treatment of Malaria in Sudan

description.narrative: Sudan - Malaria - Federal Ministry of Health of the Republic of Sudan - MOH. This program has the following goals: Ensure access to universal health coverage through health system development and enhancement of the capacities of health care workers taking into account the scientific measures and rational use of medicines and technologies, with the participation of all sectors of society while ensuring protection from catastrophic spending.. Reduce malaria morbidity and mortality by 32% from the base line of 2016 by 2020, and accelerate efforts towards elimination and attainment of malaria-free status in the low malaria intensity areas of Red Sea, Northern, River Nile and Khartoum.. The objectives of this program are: To cover 100% of targeted communities in at risk areas with a suitable vector control intervention/s through integrated vector management, by the end of 2020.. To ensure that 100% of confirmed malaria cases have access to effective anti malaria drugs, by the end of 2020. To develop a sustainable and integrated Health Information System, that provides comprehensive, quality health related information in support of evidence-based policy and planning at different system level. To improve equitable access to quality essential pharmaceuticals and health technologies.. To Improve the meaningful engagement of community based civil society organizations and networks to promote health service utilization and address inequalities related to gender, sexual and human rights. To strengthen the capacity of the Malaria Control Programme at national, state and locality levels, and working through the integrated health system, to properly plan, guide, implement, and coordinate the delivery of malaria interventions.

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for SDN-M-MOH
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
Proportion of households in targeted areas that received Indoor Residual Spraying during the reporting period
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Percentage of health facilities with essential medicines and life-saving commodities in stock
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Impact indicator for SDN-M-MOH
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Maternal mortality ratio, per 100,000 population
Neonatal mortality rate, per 100,000 population
Under 5 mortality rate per 1000 live births
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Outcome indicator for SDN-M-MOH
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Percentage of existing ITNs used the previous night
Proportion of households sprayed by IRS within the last 12 months
Percentage of births attended by skilled health professional
Percentage of women attending antenatal care
